Package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators

Class OrderedPortSequencer

java.lang.Object
com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators.PortSequencer
com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators.OrderedPortSequencer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Operator
@PrimitiveOperator(description="Operator that maintains an per-input port `int64` sequence number for arriving tuples and sets it as the `portSequence` attribute of the output tuple and ensures tuples are submitted to its output port is sequence number order.", comment=" Licensed Materials - Property of IBM (C) Copyright Teracloud ApS 2024, 2024, IBM Corp. 2010, 2016 All Rights Reserved. US Government Users Restricted Rights - Use, duplication or disclosure restricted by GSA ADP Schedule Contract with IBM Corp. ") public class OrderedPortSequencer extends PortSequencer
OrderedPortSequencer extends PortSequencer to provide submission of tuples within a port ordered by the portSequence attribute.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderedPortSequencer

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception
      Create a Lock object for each input/output port (remember the class assumes a 1-1 mapping between input and output ports). The lock is a "fair" lock to try and ensure the oldest waiting thread is granted access first.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface Operator
      Overrides:
      initialize in class PortSequencer
      Throws:
      Exception

    • process

      public void process(StreamingInput<Tuple> port, Tuple tuple) throws Exception
      Process the tuple and submit it holding the port specific lock for the entire processing of the tuple. This means the assignment of the portSequence attribute and submission of the tuple are in the same critical section, leading to the order of submission matching the portSequence.
      Specified by:
      process in interface Operator
      Overrides:
      process in class PortSequencer
      Throws:
      Exception
